result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael L. Quade was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:06 pm.  Defendant Michael L. Quade in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael L. Quade in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek/Voorhees statement to motion. Court reviews transcript. Court statement that typically jail credit would be credited if revoked - Court finds that 87 days credit be reflected on JOC as credit for conditional jail time - JOC to be amended accordingly. Court sets fine review hearing for 09-19-2016 at 3:00 p.m. Adj. 1:17 p.m.
to review and correct conditional jail time and/or to reconsider presentence jail credit

records.addlTxt:
3:58 p.m. Defendant Michael L. Quade in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steve Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss Counts 1, 3, 4 and 5 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
Prison - Imposed and Stayed
6 years - 3 years Initial Confinement; 3 years extended supervision
POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Fine - $3,000 including costs/Blood Draw Surcharge/IID Surcharge
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
Jail - 1 year with Huber for all purposes
Jail credit - 85 days
Driver's Safety Plan
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA Assessment
Driver's license revoked - 36 months
IID - 36 months
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights and payment plan application given. NADVI and WEDS given.
Voorhees motion for in-patient treatment/credit. Court grants motion - allows credit for successful completion of in-patient treatment - credit to be applied at end of sentence.
Adj. 4:27 p.m.

11:34 a.m. Defendant Michael L. Quade in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael L. Quade in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Oneida County Sheriff's Deputy, Chris Conglio, called by State. Witness sworn/direct by Michlig/ Witness ID's defendant / Cross by Voorhees / Court questions witness / State marks Exhibit 1 (driving abstract) -  / Voorhees moves to dismiss OWI - 5th or 6th for lack of probable cause-Michlig statement to motion - Court statement - denies Motion to Dismiss and finds that probable cause exists and binds defendant over - State is waiting for lab results before filing Information. Bail continued. Adj. 12:10 p.m.  Arraignment scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael L. Quade in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Michael L. Quade in custody.  Steven M MIchlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Voorhees statement to bail - Michlig statement - Court statement - continues bond as as set at this time
